0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Allergic conjunctivitis - Itching; Prophylaxis: Instill 1 drop of 0.25% OPHTHALMIC solution into each eye once daily

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Allergic conjunctivitis - Itching; Prophylaxis: (2 years and older) instill 1 drop of 0.25% OPHTHALMIC solution into each eye once daily

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: Hypersensitivity to alcaftadine or any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Ophthalmic:
  • -- Eye injury and contamination of the dropper tip and solution may occur; instruct to not touch eyelids or surrounding areas with dropper tip and close bottle tightly when not in use
  • -- Red eyes; advise not to wear contact lens
  • -- Contact lens-related eye irritation; not recommended for use
  • -- Topical ophthalmic use only
  • Concomitant Use:
  • -- Remove contact lenses prior to administration and allow at least 10 minutes before reinserting after use

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Neurologic:Headache (Less than 3%)
  • Ophthalmic:Burning sensation in eye (Less than 4%), Eye irritation (Less than 4%), Itching of eye (Less than 4%), Red eye (Less than 4%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Alcaftadine is an H1 histamine receptor antagonist which inhibits the histamine release from mast cells.

1.title: Distribution
1.mono: Protein binding: 39.2%, alcaftadine; 62.7%, carboxylic acid metabolite

2.title: Metabolism
2.mono:
• Hepatic: via non-CYP450 cytosolic enzymes
  • carboxylic acid metabolite: active

3.title: Excretion
3.mono: Renal: carboxylic acid metabolite mainly excreted unchanged in the urine (oral data)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    For topical ophthalmic use only
  • Ophthalmic
    • Remove contact lenses prior to instillation of drops; may reinsert lenses 10 minutes after instillation.
    • Administer concomitant ophthalmic drugs at least 5 minutes apart.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: absence of ocular itching associated with allergic conjunctivitis is indicative of efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause nasopharyngitis, headache, and eye redness, pruritus, irritation, burning, and/or stinging.
  • Instruct patient on proper instillation technique.
  • Advise patient to remove contact lenses prior to instilling drug as preservative may be absorbed by soft lenses. Lenses may be reinserted 10 minutes following instillation.
